SEARCH
Package naming

Class ReadWriteLock

java.lang.Object
naming.ReadWriteLock
public class ReadWriteLock extends Object
A read-write lock implementation that allows multiple readers to access the resource concurrently but only one writer at a time. If a writer is active, no readers are allowed to access the resource. The lock is fair, meaning that the requests are granted in the order they were made.

  • Method Details

    • lock

      public void lock(boolean exclusive) throws InterruptedException
      Lock the resource for reading or writing. It updates the lock state, queue, and active readers/writers accordingly.
      Parameters:
      exclusive - the exclusive flag to indicate if the lock is for writing or reading
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - the interrupted exception

    • unlock

      public void unlock(boolean exclusive)
      Unlock the resource for reading or writing. It updates the lock state, queue, and active readers/writers accordingly.
      Parameters:
      exclusive - the exclusive flag to indicate if the lock is for writing or reading

    • canGrantExclusiveAccess

      private boolean canGrantExclusiveAccess(ReadWriteLock.LockRequest request)
      Check if the lock can be granted exclusively. The lock can be granted exclusively if the request is the first in the queue, there are no active readers, and there is no active writer.
      Parameters:
      request - the lock request
      Returns:
      the boolean

    • canGrantSharedAccess

      private boolean canGrantSharedAccess(ReadWriteLock.LockRequest request)
      Check if the lock can be granted as a shared lock. The lock can be granted as a shared lock if there is no active writer and the request is the first or among the first shared in the queue.
      Parameters:
      request - the lock request
      Returns:
      the boolean

    • isRequestFirst

      private boolean isRequestFirst(ReadWriteLock.LockRequest request)
      Check if the request is the first in the queue.
      Parameters:
      request - the lock request
      Returns:
      the boolean

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the lock state.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the string representation of the lock state

    • getTotalReaders

      public int getTotalReaders()
      Gets the total number of readers that have accessed the resource to be used for replication.
      Returns:
      the total number of readers

    • isWriteOperationInProgress

      public boolean isWriteOperationInProgress()
      Checks if a write operation is in progress.
      Returns:
      true if a write operation is in progress, false otherwise.

    • setWriteOperationInProgress

      public void setWriteOperationInProgress(boolean inProgress)
      Sets the write operation in progress flag.
      Parameters:
      inProgress - the in progress flag
